sentences: Aitame kirikuhakkidel kloostri suitsus taevasse lennata..
Mehed tõstsid rõõmukisa: „Lähme, näitame pappidele tuld põrguteele! Aitame kirikuhakkidel.."
context: Aitame is the first-person plural present indicative form of the Estonian verb 'aitama', which means 'to help' or 'to aid'. It corresponds to English 'we help' or 'we assist'. In the example sentence from literature, it's used in a context where men are expressing their desire to help church officials (kirikuhakkidel) by showing them fire towards hell. The word is commonly used when offering assistance or support to someone or something.
